required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Post Market Study on the Use of Cormatrix® Cangaroo ECM® (Extracellular Matrix) Envelope
clinical_study.official_title: A Post Market Observational Study to Obtain Additional Information on the Use of Cormatrix® Cangaroo ECM® Envelope

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the SECURE Study is to actively gather additional information on the use of the CorMatrix® CanGaroo ECM® Envelope in a post market observational study.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects With ECM Related Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants were followed for an average of 235.0 days.
primary_outcome.description: ECM related adverse events were collected at all study visits.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Major Pocket Infections
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants were followed for an average of 235.0 days.
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of major pocket infection included those with cellulitis in the region of the CIED pocket with wound dehiscence, erosion or purulent drainage, 2) deep incisional or organ/space (pocket) surgical site infection, 3) persistent bacteremia or 4) endocarditis.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects who have received CorMatrix® CanGaroo ECM® Envelope for an implantable electronic device placement.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have received CorMatrix® CanGaroo ECM® Envelope for an implantable electronic device placement.
Exclusion Criteria:
-

UT Health Science Center - EP Heart

reported_events.time_frame: Participants will be followed for an expected average of 3 months

group.title: CanGaroo
group.description: Data collection for information on the use of CorMatrix CanGaroo ECM Envelope

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: It was single-arm study thereby precluding the possibility of direct comparisons with a control. Also, a longer follow-up would allow for the confirmation of the long-term efficacy of the CanGaroo envelope.
